definition: should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned

sentences.english: So the personality theory's got to go.
sentences.chinese: 所以不该采用人格理论了。

sentences.english: Forensic dean blames administrative front courtyard to ought not to not see object tousle subpoena.
sentences.chinese: 法院院长责备行政庭不该不看对象乱发传票。

sentences.english: Well, shouldn't you try to stop them from making this big mistake?
sentences.chinese: 嗯，那你该不该试着阻止他们闯下大祸？

sentences.english: On the other hand the West should not be panicked into unnecessary confrontation.
sentences.chinese: 其次，西方世界不该惊慌于同中国的冲突。

sentences.english: You really shouldn't spend so much effort on it.
sentences.chinese: 你真不该在这件事上花费这么大的精力。

sentences.english: Sharon shouldn't shout at the sheep.
We should respect our teachers. You shouldn't have answered your teacher back in class。
sentences.chinese: 我们应当尊敬老师，你不该在课上同老师顶嘴。

sentences.english: I am exhausted. I shouldn't have stayed up playing PC games last night.
sentences.chinese: 我累了，昨晚我不该打游戏到很晚的。

sentences.english: He seriously debated whether or not he should charge his tenants extra for the water.
sentences.chinese: 他认真地考虑该不该向房客们收取额外的水费。

sentences.english: There should be no sub-contracting unless previously agreed with the main client.
sentences.chinese: 不该该有任何分包，除非以前与首要客户赞成。

sentences.english: Hey, Rod, maybe, you shouldn't fight that this week.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，罗得，也许，你不该这周去挑战极限。

sentences.english: Should I not be worrying about Pakistan?
sentences.chinese: 我不该担心巴基斯坦问题吗？

sentences.english: Shouldn’t I be punished for what I have done?
sentences.chinese: 我难道不该为我的所作所为得到应有的惩罚么？

sentences.english: Fire, water, and money are good servants, but bad masters.
sentences.chinese: 水火金钱是忠仆，应用不该是罪魁。

sentences.english: No one should be alone in their old age, he thought.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不该上了年纪独个儿待着，他想。

definition: unworthy/to let down/I'm sorry/excuse me/pardon me/if you please/sorry? (please repeat)
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
by no means/definitely not/as if!/yeah right!
to stop before going too far (idiom); to stop while one can/don't overdo it/stop while you're ahead
